Posts.Content: Dennyse wrote: Hi all, Just wanted to update my status to you. I had surgery on Aug 4, same day surgery. So home on drugs and TLC with Family members. However I fell from the dizziness of the side effects of the drugs. I threw my back out and boy did I hurt. But today I was able to get up and around, took a half shower, and had lunch with family in the patio. I do not know if I did any damage to the surgical site or implants, but nothing tells me there's a problem What a journey this is! How are other early Aug surgeries doing? Dx 5/31/2016, LCIS/ILC, Right, 1cm, Stage IB, Grade 1, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Post op bilateral Mastectomy x3 days Dennyse Dennyse

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2016 11:07AM Dennyse wrote: Hi Leydi, Thank you for your response. Yes, I too stopped the meds and am only on Tylenol as needed. I am now 1 week post op. Saw MD yesterday and need my drains in a bit longer. But all is going well.
Posts.Title: Post op bilateral Mastectomy x3 days Dennyse Dennyse
